section.name: The Portal
section.p:
Managing a workflow and managing jobs are the two aspects of the portal directly involved in workflow. Functions that can be undertaken when managing a workflow:
Creating a workflow
Saving a workflow
Inserting flows, sequences, control constructs, scripts and steps
Inserting a tool into a step
Assigning input and output parameters to a tool
Assigning a join condition to a step
Submitting a workflow to JES
Functions that can be undertaken when managing a job:
Browse list of jobs
Examine one job for its current status (running, completed, in error)
Examine each step within a job for its current status and any message associated with the step.
Cancel a job.
Delete a job.
A third area of the portal has important workflow implications: designing a query that can be run against a datacenter by including it within a workflow step. A fourth important area is the ability to browse files held within MySpace.
